title: Why Aliens can never visit the earth
description:
————————————————————
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite 
social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community

Interested in joining the Men of Action sales team? Apply here:
https://www.moamentoring.com/jobs/sales

channel_info.title: Michael Sartain
channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast 

🔥Teaching you how to build a network of desirable women and high-status men

👇 Click the "Men of Action" link below now to forge a high-status lifestyle and join the elites

transcription: {"text": "It's called the Fermi Paradox. Basically, the idea is how many stars are there, how many planets that are Earth-sized in those places, and how many of those planets would have organic chemicals for the possibility to create life. And the likelihood that there is life on other planets is extremely high. The problem with the aliens thing is this. The nearest star to Earth is Proxima Centauri, and it is 4.1 light years away. That is 24 trillion miles away. It would take you, at the speed of light, 186,282 miles a second, four years to get there. Human beings are not even capable of 1% the speed of light. We are not even 1,000th of 1% the speed of light at that point. You have no possibility of going that fast. You're telling me that aliens that are made of matter are capable of moving at that speed, and the likelihood that those creatures were able to come to our planet and visit us, it's like, we're not that fucking interesting. Compared to a civilization that would be able to travel that incredible amount of distance, they'd also have to have the ability to travel at near the speed of light in order to do that. So from that standpoint, are there aliens? Yes. Have they visited us? High likelihood.
